definitions.text: any collection of particles (e.g., smoke or dust) or gases that is visible
a visible mass of water or ice particles suspended at a considerable altitude

examples: his head was in the clouds

definitions.text: a cause of worry or gloom or trouble
examples: the only cloud on the horizon was the possibility of dissent by the French
after that mistake he was under a cloud

definitions.text: a group of many things in the air or on the ground
examples: a swarm of insects obscured the light
it discharged a cloud of spores
Fall weather often overcasts our beaches
The stars are obscured by the clouds
the big elm tree obscures our view of the valley

definitions.text: billow up in the form of a cloud
examples: The smoke clouded above the houses
Their faces were clouded with sadness

definitions.text: place under suspicion or cast doubt upon

examples: the stroke clouded memories of her youth

definitions.text: colour with streaks or blotches of different shades

examples: The chemical clouded the liquid to which it was added
